subject: Re: [junit] Test cases size and design
msgSnippet: On Wed, 8 May 2002 09:28:12 +0200, Robert Wenner ... No, I would create exaclty the same set of tiles that comes in the box. Frank.
messageBody:
On Wed, 8 May 2002 09:28:12 +0200, Robert Wenner
<robert@...> wrote:

> > What about keeping the orientation in the board? I think the
> > orientation is not so much an attribute of a tile but of the
> > placement of the tile on the board.
> Yes. I meant: if a makeXyz method creates a tile with a left turning
> road and a city part, do you have a look at the source code creating
> the tile and rely on the knowledge that the city will always be in
> north and the road will always be south - west or dou you allow every
> city locaction as long as the road still turns left below the city?

No, I would create exaclty the same set of tiles that comes in
the box.

Frank.
